intro: Viguiera bombycina, commonly known as the Mexican honeyflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow-orange ray flowers surrounding a central disk of smaller florets, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Viguiera bombycina typically grows in dry, sunny habitats and is often found in rocky or limestone soils. Its structure includes hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, contributing to its adaptability in arid environments.
